3000 to 11000 citizens in another 4 hours. Happy, sad, happy, sad LOL. Stupid education system. Ended up de-zoning 80% of my industrial just to re-zone it 10 minutes later. I feel like 50% of my time is spent constructing roads. On the plus side, by the time I'm done with road construction I have a healthy stack of change sitting around to buy new buildings ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Haha Yeah I spent a good 15 minutes in the highest time warp (or whatever they call it. It'll be time warp for me forever thanks to KSP) working on a highway on/offramp setup and when I was done, hoo-wee I had like a million bucks. Now I didn't start with 0 or anything but still, it was nice to see!

> 
> No demo yet. The only difference with Deluxe is a few extra landmark buildings and a soundtrack, not worth it imo.

It certainly is worth it. Yes, you only get 5 buildings, two artbooks and the sound track, but the game is dirt cheap to begin with. I view buying the Deluxe edition as a token of appreciation for the good work, allowing future updates and expansions to be more readily available for all the players.

If they charged 60 dollars or euros for the game I would not think about spending more, but since the Deluxe Edition can be had for under 30 euros I would encourage everyone to spend the money they would have otherwise spent anyway. Whatever you pay, you certainly get your money's worth.

For what it's worth you guys do know you can pause time right? Click the play/pause icon or hit the spacebar.
You will need that too. Some types of construction/deconstruction are truly not appreciated by the people in your city, so it is better to magically make it appear before them.

> 
> Wait, so if people are moved in to an area and you build some specific thing, they'll get mad... Unless the game is paused?

No, not really ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) Tearing up certain things or breaking transportation routes will. It is almost impossible to build a complete and functioning structure at once.

I see, so if you're moving a park and are going to replace it with a plaza, you can avoid the red frowny faces if you do it with time paused. But does it actually hurt? Do the green smiley faces when the new plaza are placed counteract any frowns from the park vanishing?

> 
> I see, so if you're moving a park and are going to replace it with a plaza, you can avoid the red frowny faces if you do it with time paused. But does it actually hurt? Do the green smiley faces when the new plaza are placed counteract any frowns from the park vanishing?

The frowny faces are not really an issue, but especially roads or other resources that are gone for some or even any time can cause a ripple effect. Fiddling with the wrong highway connection can really tank certain areas or demands. The same goes for zoning or changing road directions.
